ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Question 10: I thought that the instructors were very informative and were helpful whenever we asked them for guidance and advice. Question 12: I think the value of the course is heavily dependent on the project that you are on. Some client projects seemed more challenging than others due to issues with communication with the clients or a lack of data for research.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Working on a project with a client.
Our clients and independently working on exciting projects

The practical aspects of the clinic were great. We got to work with actual clients on substantive projects. Additionally, working in groups was very useful for learning how to manage expectations, navigate different dynamics, and collaborate.
Experience engaging with clients, learning to work efficiently and effectively within a team
It was invaluable working with a client on a REAL issue! I learned a ton, not only on the subject matter of my project, but also about my client, and the coalition members that they worked with.

The best aspect is that we had the chance to work on a project that will be very useful to our client. My project involved a large amount of research so I was happy to broaden the breadth of my knowledge in the subject area my project focused on. It was also very helpful to have a great partner on my project. They were very knowledgeable about the subject matter and helped fill in information in areas which I had less experience.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Lectures are not that helpful. I think it would be better to reserve more group work time.

I would suggest that the advisors check in with groups members individually more often. In several cases, some group members didn't necessarily pull their weight when it mattered, which made it difficult for the rest of the group. Also, some of the class lectures weren't really applicable to the clinic.

It would be great to have more interaction with other student projects as we're working on our project deliverables. I would also find it valuable to find out what projects were most useful to clients in the past, and to figure out how they have been used or modified since the clinic project.
I think client projects - specifically those relating to China and countries that have restrictions on speech - need to be more thoroughly vetted and carefully considered.

Some of the lectures seemed to try to cover too much, so they stayed surface level and brisk - but I also understand that with the diversity of projects requires that we do quick snapshots of the environmental law field. As an environmental law student, many of the lectures also dragged on, given that I have taken many many courses on topics that are covered in mere hours.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: There was seemingly no connection between the lectures and our projects. I think the lectures could be eliminated.
The periodic group workshops were helpful because they made sure we stayed on track. Hearing about other group's experience was also useful, because often we had similar concerns.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The client I worked with is doing amazing work that I would like to get involved with in the future. The clinic provided a great introduction to what it is like to be an environmental consultant.
Great chance for experience in particular fields of interest, especially when those interests are not very well represented in classes.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to work on a specific project applicable to my career interests.
I took this course to get more hands on experience with environmental issues.
I was shopping classes and many of the projects interested me.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I don't feel that I gained additional skills. I do think I honed skills I already possessed.
Yes, I thoroughly enjoyed working on a clinic project, not just because the project topic was new and fascinating, but because I felt as if I was actually contributing to a solution.

Yes, above and beyond! I learned so much more than I expected, and looked forward to working on my project every day. It feels good to contribute to a real client's needs, and to learn so much while doing it.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Working with a peer in a different field.
Wonderful experience collaborating with students from another school with very divergent expertise.

Managing group dynamics and expectations was often difficult, especially when facing deadlines. Also figuring out how to work most efficiently was complicated by people's different work ethics. I did, however, appreciate bouncing ideas off of my group members and feeling like I wasn't in the project alone.

Some of the members of this group were not particularly strong writers and one had never worked on a group paper before and so she was not used to having her work edited by others - this made writing the paper difficult.
Great to continue gaining practice working with a group, especially in a project that requires such long term relationships and different tasks.
It was also very helpful to have a great partner on my project. They were very knowledgeable about the subject matter and helped fill in information in areas which I had less experience.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: When selecting a project, make sure you understand exactly what the client wants. If it's unclear or too broad, getting started on the project is going to be arduous.

It's a ton of work, your work actually means something, and you will have no idea what you're doing or if you're doing a good job. It's perhaps the most useful class at FES. Take it. And log your hours early and often!
Be open-minded regarding what project you decide to undertake. While some use the EPC as an opportunity to further pursue a specific interest, others find value in exploring a completely new topic.
Devote time to project evenly across semester, make sure team members are all contributing their fair share of work
Do not take projects on that involve working with non-profits/organizations based in China. Try to work with individuals that have strong writing backgrounds.

Make sure you choose a project that interests you. It is a lot of work and can sometimes be a bit frustrating coordinating with clients, so it is important that you choose a subject matter that you are curious about.
